o: Tax rules governing cross-border transactions and income

o: Determination of where a person or entity is considered resident for tax purposes

q: Tax residence determines which country has primary taxing rights.

o: Tax imposed by the country where income originates

o: Agreement between two countries to avoid double taxation

q: The ______ model is used as a template for most tax treaties.
Tax treaties override domestic law in most countries.

o: Tax deducted at source on payments to non-residents

q: Withholding tax is deducted before payment reaches the recipient.

o: Fixed place of business through which enterprise conducts activities

q: The ______ concept determines if a foreign entity is taxable in a country.
PE creates taxing rights for the source country.

o: Pricing of transactions between related parties in different jurisdictions

o: Credit for taxes paid to foreign countries against domestic tax liability

q: Foreign tax credit eliminates double taxation.

o: Foreign entity controlled by domestic shareholders subject to anti-deferral rules

o: Jurisdiction with low or zero taxation and financial secrecy

q: Tax havens attract profits shifted from high-tax countries.

q: BEPS aims to align taxation with economic activity.

o: Using interposed entities to access treaty benefits not intended for the taxpayer

q: The ______ provisions deny treaty benefits to abusive arrangements.
Treaty shopping is considered tax abuse.

q: MAP provides relief from double taxation disputes.

q: APAs provide certainty for transfer pricing.

q: Tiebreaker rules apply when both countries claim residence.

q: GloBE uses book income as the tax base.
